lexUnit.name: bewilderment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: in a state of confusion and uncertainty

sentence.text: What had once been a largely invisible world of mental hospitals , private suffering , and professional services now appears in local communities as homelessness , strange persons in public , and bewilderment about who is responsible for whom .
She squinted in bewilderment at the ten or so boarders who had formed her little band of helpers .
" No , " I said , trying to sound convincing but daunted by the simple bewilderment in his face .
` Carpenter ? " her father asked with a tinge of bewilderment in his voice .
She did n't want to trouble the penguin with the bewilderment in her eyes .
The old hands at machine knitting glibly talk about ` two-thirties " to the bewilderment of the newcomers at the knitting club .
The bewilderment of the child Nizan can not be overstated .
David filled her dreams ; the ecstasy of their lovemaking , and the pain and bewilderment of his abrupt departure .
Scott ran a hand through his hair , bewilderment on his face .
Downstairs in the lobbies , Tories were running around in equal bewilderment over the Speakership .
To her bewilderment they both dissolved into giggles .
She saw his fear , his bewilderment , and above all , a kind of astonishment at the enormity of the complications that lay ahead .
The other side of the story is the pain felt by women when their children suffer , and their bewilderment when that suffering is self-inflicted .
His voice was as sensual as raw silk , but when he saw her bewilderment his eyes drifted over to Mandy 's table .
Gloria stared , her mouth agape , then turned to Ruth in bewilderment .
She got up and checked the wardrobes , and her bemusement became sheer bewilderment .
A frown of exasperation lined her brow as she shook her dark head in bewilderment .
Sonny turned in bewilderment to Johnny , then lumbered out after his brother .

To those workers who profess bewilderment as to how they might help , who feel their knowledge in sexual matters is insufficient or are doubtful of their capabilities for sexual counselling and aid , one would suggest that they raise the matter within their training departments .
The rest simply stood in a state of considerable bewilderment , trying to ensure that they had not only accurately recorded but also understood what Woolton had said .
Shiona frowned at the phone in total bewilderment .
Most will privately confess to an initial sense of utter bewilderment , but necessity will drive them to adapt to their new way of life .
Her lovely face reflecting her complete and utter bewilderment , she queried slowly , ` Why on earth would I want to claim kinship ? "
There was such masculine bewilderment in his deep voice at the unexpected display of emotion that Fran smiled .
Constance looked at him in bewilderment .
Mr Stokill must have noticed my look of bewilderment .
He paused as his mother stared at him in bewilderment .
